summary: I’m starting to think that what the writers are doing to Jaime atm is the same as what they did to Sansa last season. Like where...
body: I’m starting to think that what the writers are doing to Jaime atm is the same as what they did to Sansa last season. Like where they made the fandom believe that she had turned against her sister and was going to have her executed only for it to be revealed at the last minute that she was actually turning on Littlefinger. People lost their shit at that scene and I’m sure D+D who live for plot twists would love to recreate that reaction. Sansa and Jaime also have a lot of parallels with each other, they’re both “slow learners” who have gone on incredible arcs and the general fandom reaction to Sansa during that time is playing out in a similar way for Jaime. It would make sense for them to reveal at the last minute that Jaime is actually a good guy and knew what he was doing the whole time

blog.name: springwolvesofwinterfell
blog.title: Spring comes to Winterfell
blog.description: My personal collection of GoT/ ASoIaF

title: 8x04 Some takeaways (P2)
body:
Part 1

In this part, we will continue with what happened during the feast. 

4. Davos was still concerned about the Lord of Light

Even after the war against the Dead is over, Davos still had lingering question about the the Lord of Light and his purpose. Given what we know about R’hllor, the Lord of Light might not be a good guy at all. So keep this in mind, in case we encounter this cult and their Lord again. 

Lord of Light. We play his game for him, we fight his war and win, and then he fucks off. No signs, no blessings. Who knows what he wants. 

5. Everyone’d rather chill with their companions than with the Queen

The very notable dynamic during the feast was, everyone was very cheerful and allowed themselves to be loosen up. In such moment, all people wanted to spend their time with the company they were most comfortable with. The Queen was merely present in their eyes. No one came to her or really wanted to spend their fun time with her. Dany was reaping what she sowed, she wanted to be feared and obeyed, she wanted servants not friends. The result: she had no friends at all. Grey Worm, Missandei and her Dothraki riders didn’t come to celebrate with her either.

Jon was happily celebrating with Sansa, his fellow Northmen and the wildings. Forgetting about courtesy, he sat on the table with his back against Dany. 

Photo: tarotjoie

Dany was almost non-existent. This is Jon, Sansa & Co’s family party.  

Gif:  ladystarks

Tormund saved Dany’s face by cheering for the Dragon Queen. 

Dany tried to fit in by praising Arya, who was absent during the feast. 

The crowd cheered with her. But very quickly, everyone returned to their own group and Dany was alone again. 

Gif: kalena-henden

Even her Hand prefered to sit and drink with his brother, his former squire and Brienne rather than sticking around with the Queen. We’ve never seen Tyrion being genuinely happy like that since he joined Dany’s camp (except the period when Dany was away, and Tyrion spent time to bond with Missandei and GW). He was enjoying the best time of his life with Jaime.

6. The undeniable love triangle

Again, Jon was framed between Sansa and Dany. There was awkward silence between them since his two ladies were not fond of each other. 

After cheering to the crowd, Jon remembered that Dany was also there, so he turned to her side and smiled to her. It’s very rare to see Jon happy and relaxed around Dany. But they had won a war together, Dany and her force were of great help to him, so Jon had reason to be open and friendly to her.

Sansa was giving her “brother” heart eyes. She looked at him with so much admiration and adoration, like he was the true hero in her song. 

Dany also gave her nephew-lover a loving look. 

Sansa noticed the Queen and her “brother”, and she was so annoyed.

Sansa: I’m done with this sh*t. My eyes are aching.

Jon: Anything wrong with you, Sansa? I’m confused.

For a little while, Dany forgot that she was the Queen. She looked like a shy girl who was so in love. 

I admit, Dany was very cute in this scene. I love her that way.

Gif:  thatmansplayinggalaga

Conclusion: If this is not a love triangle, I don’t know what else to call it.

6. Dany was increasingly isolated and she was jealous of the love Jon received from his friends and people

Dany did not remain lovely for long. Right after that came the ugly part.

Tormund was very drunk, so he just said outright what he realy thought. He praised Jon for his leadership, braveness, compassion, strength, and the ability to ride a dragon. 

Dany is no longer special with Jon’s presence. He has a lot of friends while she does not. He is muched loved when she is isolated. Even dragon-riding, the very capability she is so proud about herself, is no longer her uniqueness. 

Dany was clearly hurt when Tormund called Jon a King. Jon was aware of her feelings, so he shared a look with her to make sure that she was alright.

Gif: nothinghappensinalstonville

What I found interesting in this sequence was the choice to frame Dany with a close-up shot with a wide-angle lens. A wide-angle portraiture makes us more engaged with the character’s state of mind because it draws our eyes closer to her/him. But with this framing, the character’s face is also distorted, giving her/him a very unsual look. So this kind of shot is rarely used for close-ups, unless the director has a very specific purpose to tell us something about the character.

In this frame, Dany had a very ominous look, terrifying even. With the wide-angle lens, her eyes are accentuated. She is fueled with jealousy. Some dangerous thoughts are growing inside her.

Photo: lostlittlesatellites

Dany was hurt, sad and lonely.

Varys noticed that the Queen was not feeling good and welcomed here.

Dany looked around. Everyone was happy with their companions, while she was left alone in the corner. 

Tyrion was so cheerful around his brother that he totally ignored his Queen.

Gif:  loversphilosophy

Jon continued to forget about her presence. He was occupied with his pals. His back faced her again.  

Disappointed and angry, she left the Hall. 

The moment Jon and Dany celebrated their joint victory, their relationship (whatever it might call) started to fall apart because of Dany’s jealousy. She was used to be the centre of attention, so she was not happy that he was more loved and appreciated than her. 

This is a complete contrast to Jon and Sansa’s relationship.

Their joint effort brought them together. Sansa was genuinely happy that Jon was named King in the North.

She noticed LF as a threat to Jon, and since then she worked hard to shield him from any harm caused by this man.

She was not bitter that Jon received all the recognition while she was actually the one who saved the day. She just wanted him to listen to her counsel and constantly acknowledged his good leadership and her faith in him.

So the future of Jon & Dany’s relationship is not very bright, whilst Jon & Sansa have more hope to build a solid relationship built on mutual respect.

Tormund was very drunk, so he just said outright what he realy thought. He praised Jon for his leadership, braveness, compassion, strength, and the ability to ride a dragon. 

Dany is no longer special with Jon’s presence. He has a lot of friends while she does not. He is muched loved when she is isolated. Even dragon-riding, the very capability she is so proud about herself, is no longer her uniqueness. 

Dany was clearly hurt when Tormund called Jon a King. Jon was aware of her feelings, so he shared a look with her to make sure that she was alright.

Gif: nothinghappensinalstonville

What I found interesting in this sequence was the choice to frame Dany with a close-up shot with a wide-angle lens. A wide-angle portraiture makes us more engaged with the character’s state of mind because it draws our eyes closer to her/him. But with this framing, the character’s face is also distorted, giving her/him a very unsual look. So this kind of shot is rarely used for close-ups, unless the director has a very specific purpose to tell us something about the character.

In this frame, Dany had a very ominous look, terrifying even. With the wide-angle lens, her eyes are accentuated. She is fueled with jealousy. Some dangerous thoughts are growing inside her.

Photo: lostlittlesatellites

Dany was hurt, sad and lonely.

Varys noticed that the Queen was not feeling good and welcomed here.

Dany looked around. Everyone was happy with their companions, while she was left alone in the corner. 

Tyrion was so cheerful around his brother that he totally ignored his Queen.

Gif:  loversphilosophy

Jon continued to forget about her presence. He was occupied with his pals. His back faced her again.  

Disappointed and angry, she left the Hall. 

The moment Jon and Dany celebrated their joint victory, their relationship (whatever it might call) started to fall apart because of Dany’s jealousy. She was used to be the centre of attention, so she was not happy that he was more loved and appreciated than her. 

This is a complete contrast to Jon and Sansa’s relationship.

Their joint effort brought them together. Sansa was genuinely happy that Jon was named King in the North.

She noticed LF as a threat to Jon, and since then she worked hard to shield him from any harm caused by this man.

She was not bitter that Jon received all the recognition while she was actually the one who saved the day. She just wanted him to listen to her counsel and constantly acknowledged his good leadership and her faith in him.

So the future of Jon & Dany’s relationship is not very bright, whilst Jon & Sansa have more hope to build a solid relationship built on mutual respect.
trail.content_abstract:
Part 1

In this part, we will continue with what happened during the feast. 

4. Davos was still concerned about the Lord of Light

Even after the war against the Dead is over, Davos still had lingering question about the the Lord of Light and his purpose. Given what we know about R’hllor, the Lord of Light might not be a good guy at all. So keep this in mind, in case we encounter this cult and their Lord again. 

Lord of Light. We play his game for him, we fight his war and win, and then he fucks off. No signs, no blessings. Who knows what he wants. 

5. Everyone’d rather chill with their companions than with the Queen

The very notable dynamic during the feast was, everyone was very cheerful and allowed themselves to be loosen up. In such moment, all people wanted to spend their time with the company they were most comfortable with. The Queen was merely present in their eyes. No one came to her or really wanted to spend their fun time with her. Dany was reaping what she sowed, she wanted to be feared and obeyed, she wanted servants not friends. The result: she had no friends at all. Grey Worm, Missandei and her Dothraki riders didn’t come to celebrate with her either.

Jon was happily celebrating with Sansa, his fellow Northmen and the wildings. Forgetting about courtesy, he sat on the table with his back against Dany. 

Photo: tarotjoie

Dany was almost non-existent. This is Jon, Sansa & Co’s family party.  

Gif:  ladystarks

Tormund saved Dany’s face by cheering for the Dragon Queen. 

Dany tried to fit in by praising Arya, who was absent during the feast. 

The crowd cheered with her. But very quickly, everyone returned to their own group and Dany was alone again. 

Gif: kalena-henden

Even her Hand prefered to sit and drink with his brother, his former squire and Brienne rather than sticking around with the Queen. We’ve never seen Tyrion being genuinely happy like that since he joined Dany’s camp (except the period when Dany was away, and Tyrion spent time to bond with Missandei and GW). He was enjoying the best time of his life with Jaime.

summary: Sweet Robin is a baby, Sansa marrying him would be disgusting. Hardyng  has death written all over him, he would've been...
question: Sweet Robin is a baby, Sansa marrying him would be disgusting. Hardyng  has death written all over him, he would've been introduced already if it was going to happen. He could've ridden in with the kotv.
answer: Book SR yes but I think they aged show SR up and gave him Harry the Heir’s storyline. So if Sansa is marrying Harry in the books, then she might marry show SR. Who knows? I’m team Sansa is a lesbian so I’m not enthusiastic about her marrying a man

OTPs: Stelena, Ashburn, the Goblin Couple, Merthur, Scira, Stalia, Bonkai, Silvermadi, Sasil, Gallavich, Micasher, Jax x Tara and more! This is not a Damon Salvatore friendly blog. summary: Agree with the other anon. Sansa IS being a ruler in Winterfell but she isn’t a feminist. Sansa is the old status quo. Dany...
question: Agree with the other anon. Sansa IS being a ruler in Winterfell but she isn’t a feminist. Sansa is the old status quo. Dany asked for the opinion of Missandei a lot of times about politics. She said another woman will rule Mereen. Dany did everything she could to stop the Dothraki from raping women. Sansa hasn’t done anything to improve the position of women wherever she was.
answer:
My god, it’s like context isn’t a thing for anons. Sansa was a prisoner up until season 6, what kind of influence did she have in King’s Landing? This was her life in King’s Landing

This was her life in the Vale

This was her life in Winterfell

she was busy trying to survive and then did what kindness she could with what little she had at the time and when she had the opportunity to take back the North, she did and now she’s ruling, what exactly about her fighting for an independent North, something women and men of the North have wanted since season 1, is maintaining the status quo? She’s done nothing, she’s said nothing to suggest that she doesn’t value the opinions and contributions of women.

With regards to Daenerys, let’s talk about the Dothraki. Let’s talk about the fact that when she stopped the men from continuing to rape the women of the village, she felt like they owed her their lives, she felt entitled to their gratitude

and then when she kills the khals in season 6 it’s so she can have her own khalasar for her own war and her own agenda. She asked Missandei’s opinion once from what I can recall and again I love how we brush over the power imbalance of that relationship but I honestly don’t have the time to get into who is a better white feminist.

blog.name: xprettypoppyx
blog.title: PrettyPoppy
blog.description: Fanfic Writer (Primarily Sanrion and Spuffy), Aspiring Romance Novelist, NaNoWriMo Overachiever - I write, therefore I am.

title: The Bastard of Winterfell
body:
I’ve started posting a new novel-length Sanrion fic, “The Bastard of Winterfell.”

Summary: After being convicted of Joffrey’s murder, Tyrion Lannister escapes King’s Landing and spends the next five years in exile. When he finally returns to Westeros, he discovers that there is a new Lord of Winterfell, a little boy named Eddard Lannister. Although Sansa swears the child is his, Tyrion is too jaded to believe it, even though he once spent the night in Sansa’s bed.

https://archiveofourown.org/works/18781405/chapters/44558803

blog.name: unfuckablebogtroll
blog.title: turns up late for armageddon with starbucks
blog.description: I mostly chatter about movies, with a pinch of politics and general ramblings thrown in

body:
Plot Twist

Daeny doesn’t burn King’s Landing, she fucks off back to Essos because Westeros is trash and that ugly ass chair isn’t even worth this level of absolute bullshit. She and Grey Worm go to Naath and protect the peaceful people there in Missandei’s memory.

Euron kills Cersei when he figures out that baby don’t look like him, then dies of dysentery. The people of Westeros decide this whole monarchy business sucks the bag and seize the means of production.

The Starks fuck off back to the North, rebuild Winterfell, turn Castle Black into a trading post with the Free Folk, solidifying a much friendlier relationship, and do away with the concept of bastards entirely, passing their name down matrilineally, or through adoption. Bran just casually spills the tea on how to make Valyrian steel again, and by perfecting the method before anybody else, they make a ton of money and also protect their borders.

Arya and Gendry redefine what it means to be a “lord” and a “lady” and are very happy together whether they are in the North, Storm’s End, or traveling the world.
